name: steel cutlery
user_text:
Did you know that 40 billion disposable plastic utensils are used in the U.S. every year?
Consider keeping one set of stainless steel cutlery and washing them after use.
This gives you 7 green points per week!

name: reusable grocery bags
user_text:
Did you know that a single plastic bag can take upto 1000 years to degrade.
Consider taking one or more reusable cloth bags to the grocery store.
You can buy them at most grocery stores.
Each reusable bag gives you 21 green points per week!

name: takeout containers
user_text:
Did you know that Americans consume 200 million plastic food containers every day? 
Consider taking your own carry-out container when you dine out.
You can keep one in your car at all times
Each takeout container gives you 18 green points per week!

name: reusable bottle
user_text:
Did you know that Americans throw away 35 billion plastic bottles every year.
Consider taking your own bottle or mug when you go to juice shop
Each reusable drinkware gives you 14 green point per week!

name: no more plastic straws
user_text:
Did you know that Americans use 500 Million Straws Every Single Day?
Consider not using a straw or using a steel straw when you dine out next.
Refusing straws you 7 green points per week!

name: shower habits
user_text:
Did you know that the average American shower uses 17.2 gallons (65.1 liters) and lasts for 8.2 minutes at average flow rate of 2.1 gallons per minute (gpm) (7.9 lpm).
Consider limiting your shower to 5 minutes every day.
Also, consider shutting off the water while you are lathering.
This saves 70 gallons of water per week and gives you 50 green points per week!

name: use dishwasher instead of hand-washing
user_text:
Did you know that you use up to 27 gallons of water per load by hand versus as little as 3 gallons with an ENERGY STAR-rated dishwasher.
Use a dishwasher as much as possible. Just scrape off large food scraps before loading!!
This saves 200 gallons of water per week and gives you 28 green points per week!

name: native garden instead of lawn
user_text:
Did you know that one-third of residential water use goes toward watering the lawn and garden?
But flowers, grasses, and bushes native to the area have adapted to regional rainfall rates—so require no water—and have better defenses against predators.
Another bonus: Native plants enhance overall biodiversity.
This saves 20 gallons of water per day and gives you 84 green points per week!

name: fix water leaks
user_text:
Did you know that a 1/16-inch opening in a leaking faucet could waste up to 100 gallons a day?
Tour your home or work monthly, find dripping faucets, showerheads, hoses, and sprinklers and fix them.
This saves 10 gallons of water per day and gives you 25 green points per week!

name: dont leave the tap running
user_text:
Did you know that closing the tap while you wash, brush, etc can save up to 15 gallons a day?
This gives you 21 green points per week!

name: use cloth instead of paper
user_text:
Did you know that we currently use more than 13 billion pounds of paper towels each year which equals more than 3,000 tons of paper towel waste?
Use a cloth towel instead of paper towel whenenver you can.
This gives you 21 green points per week!

name: use cloth towel instead of paper towel
user_text:
Did you know that we currently use more than 13 billion pounds of paper towels each year which equals more than 3,000 tons of paper towel waste?
Use a cloth towel instead of paper towel whenenver you can.
This gives you 21 green points per week!

name: paperless
user_text:
Did you know that despite having only 5% of the world’s population, the U.S. uses 30% of the world’s paper?
Use electronically copies instead of paper materials whenenver possible.
This gives you 7 green points per week!

name: print double-sided
user_text:
Did you know that it takes an average of 5 liters of water to produce one piece of A4 paper?
Print double-sided to reduce paper waste by 50%.
This gives you 21 green points per week!

name: recycle used paper
user_text:
Did you know that recycling 1 ton of paper saves around 682 gallons of oil, 26500 liters of water and 17 trees?
Recycle unwanted papers in office and home.
This gives you 21 green points per week!

name: reusable coffee mugs
user_text:
Did you know that paper cups are not recyclable because of the plastic liner and coffee contamination?
Consider taking your own  mug when you go to starbucks.
Each reusable mug gives you 14 green point per week!

name: recycled papers
user_text:
Did you know that recycled papers look and feel as fine as non-recycled papers?
Invest in recycled papers.
This gives you 14 green point per week!
